body:
So I dont know how to combine different aspects of icons into 1 icon image (hearts hunger bar etc...)

I was thinking if someone could show me how to do this or do it for me? Here are the hearts, hunger bar, crosshair, air bar, armor bar I want, and XP bar:

Hearts-https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T0vykUtnh5M (Toxic waste's pack v3 btw)

Hunger bar-https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1PtfsXQD6q4 (LegoSean's/ItsSean's pack)

Armor bar-Default

Crosshair-https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UDsJ796ouAA(Huahwi's edited pack)

Air bar-https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1PtfsXQD6q4 (LegoSean's/ItsSean's pack)

 XP Bar:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z8DDnaiaqJ0 (Twaeked choclate pack)

Everything else should be R3D craft please.

Thanks!

title: Help with Icons

replies.body:
use WinRaR and Paint.Net  then download the texture packs and open them up with WinRaR (Or a different App (Not a Phone app :)) )  look for textures/gui/icons and edit it with paint.net



(Soz if this is hard to understand)
replies.body_tagged:
use WinRaR and Paint.Net  then download the texture packs and open them up with WinRaR (Or a different App (Not a Phone app :)) )  look for textures/gui/icons and edit it with paint.net



(Soz if this is hard to understand)

replies.body:
Do you want just copy and paste the icons into 1 texture pack?

If yes there is how:
STEP 1: Download WinRaR and Paint.Net
STEP 2: Download all texture packs
STEP 3: Open them with WinRaR
STEP 4: Select texture pack, and go to textures>gui>icons> (There should be image that you want to edit)
STEP 5: Save all textures into 1 folder, if you don't know how to correct export them, go to my profile and contact me with skype. I'm glad to help you
STEP 6: Change folder into .rar, move to .minecraft>textures and you are done!

Contact me on skype, I'll try to explain you better than here...
replies.body_tagged:

STEP 5: Save all textures into 1 folder, if you don't know how to correct export them, go to my profile and contact me with skype. I'm glad to help you
STEP 6: Change folder into .rar, move to .minecraft>textures and you are done!

Contact me on skype, I'll try to explain you better than here...

replies.body_tagged: Like a composite picture where there are several elements from other photos all put in one?

replies.body:
For the icons aspect of a Minecraft resource pack, all of the icons have to be in a specific part of the .png file. It's like making skins - the head, hat, body, etc. are all in specific locations. This is the same case for icons.

@OP I can try and do it myself, but I'm not that good at it. I'll see what I can do :)
